wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Milne Usher (26 September 1891 – 21 January 1981, Haddington) was a Scottish rugby union player, who played at number eight, and also captained Scotland. He was capped sixteen times between 1912-1922 (partly due to the hiatus caused by World War I).
Because of this, he has one of the longest international careers on record.
